alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 13 at 5:26AM PDT until March 15 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * CHANGES...Lesser lower elevation snow amounts Tuesday and Wednesday. * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations through Monday: Up to 3 inches at lake level and around Truckee, with 8 to 16 inches above 7000 feet. For Tuesday into Wednesday, accumulations of 2 to 6 inches at lake level and Truckee, with 1 to 3 feet above 7000 feet. Sierra ridge gusts above 100 mph and wave heights 2 to 5 feet on Lake Tahoe by Monday night and Tuesday. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible at times. Snow loading on structures will increase due to the additional rain and snow being absorbed into the deep snowpack, along with higher risks for dangerous roofalanches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will vary between 6000 and 6500 feet through Monday evening, then rise between 7000 and 7500 feet Tuesday morning, before falling during the afternoon to below 6000 feet by late Tuesday night. The heaviest overall snowfall rates are expected on Tuesday. Isolated lightning is also possible during heavier snow.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
